keyword: calories in chick fil a fries
title: Calories in Chick-fil-A Fries
meta_description: Learn calories in Chick-fil-A fries for a medium serving—420 kcal—plus carbs, fat, protein, sodium, and easy tweaks for your order.
assumptions: Medium serving (~125 g) of waffle potato fries, fried in canola oil, no added seasonings or dips; based on official Chick-fil-A data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, portion size, frying method, and customizations. Check Chick-fil-A app or site for latest values.

quick_answer.text: A medium serving of Chick-fil-A waffle fries contains 420 kcal and 5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a medium Chick-fil-A fries?
faqs.a: 420 kcal for a medium serving of waffle potato fries.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in Chick-fil-A fries?
faqs.a: 45 g total carbs, including 5 g fiber, per medium serving.

faqs.q: Are Chick-fil-A fries high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, 240 mg sodium per medium serving—about 10% of daily value.

faqs.q: Calories in small vs. large Chick-fil-A fries?
faqs.a: Small: ~320 kcal; large: ~520 kcal; medium is 420 kcal.

faqs.q: Do Chick-fil-A fries have trans fat?
faqs.a: No trans fat (0 g) in a medium serving, thanks to canola oil.
